text.div:
SHR EncounterPerformed Profile

SHR Mapping Summary

shr.encounter.EncounterPerformed maps to Encounter:
  Subject maps to subject
  TypeAsaCoding maps to class  // class is a coding, not a CodeableConcept. We should be able to handle that
  ServiceProvider maps to serviceProvider
  ServiceGiven maps to type
  PerformedContext.Status maps to status
  PerformedContext.OccurrenceTimeOrPeriod maps to period
  PerformedContext.Participant maps to participant.individual
  constrain participant.type to 0..1
  PerformedContext.Participant.ParticipationType maps to participant.type
  PerformedContext.Participant.ParticipationPeriod maps to participant.period
  PerformedContext.RelatedRequest maps to incomingReferral
  constrain location to 0..1
  PerformedContext.Facility maps to location.location
  PerformedContext.Reason maps to reason
  <TBD "HealthConcern"> maps to indication

name: SHR EncounterPerformed Profile
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative

element.definition: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain any narrative
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comment:
Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. 

This element is labelled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation.

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded in formation is added later.

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: If content was generated during a patient encounter, related encounter is the encounter where the information was gained.
The person or organization who created the entry and is responsible for (and may certify) the content.
The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from who created the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.
The most specific code (lowest level term) describing the kind or sort of thing being represented.
A class or division of people or things having particular shared characteristics
ActionContext indicating actual performance or execution of a healthcare-related action, e.g., 3rd dose of Hepatitis B vaccine administered on Dec 4th 2012, appendectomy performed today.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension
The justification for an action or non-action, conclusion, opinion, etc.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension
The justification for an action or non-action, conclusion, opinion, etc.
A set of codes drawn from different coding systems, representing the same concept.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
An item that can constitute the payload of an Entry, aka an EntryElement.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
The point in time or span of time in which something happens.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
An object (usually a Person, Party, or Organization but potentially a device or other Entity) that participates in a task or activity.
Position in workflow.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
The technique used to carry out an action, for example, the specific imaging technical or assessment vehicle.
The request that this action fulfills
The plan that this action fulfills

Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.
The result of performing an action or behavior, for example, an adverse reaction or new finding.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
The date when the provider received a referral for service. A referral includes an oral, written, faxed or electronic request for services made by the client or on the client's behalf.
The type of person or entity that instigated the encounter.
Whether the patient is undergoing treatment voluntarily, or under a legal order.
The source of payment for the current encounter.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. element.short: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known
element.definition: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

element.short: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +
element.definition: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.
element.comment:
Note that internal business rules will detemine the appropraite transitions that may occur between statuses (and also classes).

This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the encounter as not currently valid.

mapping.map: No clear equivalent in HL7 v2; active/finished could be inferred from PV1-44, PV1-45, PV2-24; inactive could be inferred from PV2-16

element.definition: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.
element.comment: The current status is always found in the current version of the resource, not the status history.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

element.short: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +
element.definition: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

element.short: The time that the episode was in the specified status
element.definition: The time that the episode was in the specified status.
inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +.

The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.

This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transisions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kindof discharge from emergency to inpatient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.definition: inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +.

element.short: The time that the episode was in the specified class
element.definition: The time that the episode was in the specified class.
Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).
element.comment: Since there are many ways to further classify encounters, this element is 0..*.

element.short: Indicates the urgency of the encounter
element.definition: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

binding.description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

element.short: The patient ro group present at the encounter
element.definition: The patient ro group present at the encounter.
element.comment: While the encounter is always about the patient, the patient may not actually be known in all contexts of use, and there may be a group of patients that could be anonymous (such as in a group therapy for Alcoholics Anonymous - where the recording of the encounter could be used for billing on the number of people/staff and not important to the context of the specific patients) or alternately in veterinary care a herd of sheep receiving treatment (where the animals are not individually tracked).

element.short: Episode(s) of care that this encounter should be recorded against
element.definition: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care, and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

element.short: The ReferralRequest that initiated this encounter
element.definition: The referral request this encounter satisfies (incoming referral).

element.short: List of participants involved in the encounter
element.definition: Thelist ofpeopleresponsible for providing the service.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. element.definition: Role of participant in encounter.
element.comment: The participant type indicates how an individual partitipates in an encounter. It includes non-practitioner participants, and for practitioners this is to describe the action type in the context of this encounter (e.g. Admitting Dr, Attending Dr, Translator, Consulting Dr). This is different to the practitioner roles which are functional roles, derived from terms of employment, education, licensing, etc.

element.short: Period of time during the encounter that the participant participated
element.definition: The period of time that the specified participant participated in the encounter. These can overlap or be sub-sets of the overall encounter's period.

element.short: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient
element.definition: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient.

element.short: The appointment that scheduled this encounter
element.definition: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

element.short: The start and end time of the encounter
element.definition: The start and end time of the encounter.
element.comment: If not (yet) known, the end of the Period may be omitted.

element.short: Quantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent)
element.definition: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.
element.comment: May differ from the time the Encounter.period lasted because of leave of absence.

mapping.map: (PV1-45 less PV1-44) iff ( (PV1-44 not empty) and (PV1-45 not empty) ); units in minutes

element.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.
element.comment: For systems that need to know which was the primary diagnosis, these will be marked with the standard extension primaryDiagnosis (which is a sequence value rather than a flag, 1 = primary diagnosis).

binding.description: Reason why the encounter takes place.

mapping.map: EVN-4 / PV2-3 (note: PV2-3 is nominally constrained to inpatient admissions; HL7 v2 makes no vocabulary suggestions for PV2-3; would not expect PV2 segment or PV2-3 to be in use in all implementations )

element.short: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter
element.definition: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. element.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.
element.comment: For systems that need to know which was the primary diagnosis, these will be marked with the standard extension primaryDiagnosis (which is a sequence value rather than a flag, 1 = primary diagnosis).

mapping.map: Resources that would commonly referenced at Encounter.indication would be Condition and/or Procedure. These most closely align with DG1/PRB and PR1 respectively.

element.short: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge )
element.definition: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge ).

binding.description: The type of diagnosis this condition represents

element.short: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type)
element.definition: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type).

element.short: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter
element.definition: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.
element.comment: The billing system may choose to allocate billable items associated with the Encounter to different referenced Accounts based on internal business rules.

element.short: Details about the admission to a healthcare service
element.definition: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.
element.comment: An Encounter may cover more than just the inpatient stay. Contexts such as outpatients, community clinics, and aged care facilities are also included.The duration recorded in the period of this encounter covers the entire scope of this hospitalization record.

element.definition: Pre-admission identifier.

element.short: The location from which the patient came before admission
element.definition: The location from which the patient came before admission.

element.short: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer)
element.definition: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer).

binding.description: From where the patient was admitted.

element.short: The type of hospital re-admission that has occurred (if any). If the value is absent, then this is not identified as a readmission
element.definition: Whether this hospitalization is a readmission and why if known.

binding.description: The reason for re-admission of this hospitalization encounter.

element.short: Diet preferences reported by the patient
element.definition: Diet preferences reported by the patient.
element.comment: For example a patient may request both a dairy-free and nut-free diet preference (not mutually exclusive).
element.requirements: Used to track patient's diet restrictions and/or preference. For a complete description of the nutrition needs of a patient during their stay, one should use the nutritionOrder resource which links to Encounter.

binding.description: Medical, cultural or ethical food preferences to help with catering requirements.

element.definition: Special courtesies (VIP, board member).
Any special requests that have been made for this hospitalization encounter, such as the provision of specific equipment or other things.

element.short: Location to which the patient is discharged
element.definition: Location to which the patient is discharged.

element.short: Category or kind of location after discharge
element.definition: Category or kind of location after discharge.

element.short: List of locations where the patient has been
element.definition: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.
element.comment: Virtual encounters can be recorded in the Encounter by specifying a location reference to a location of type "kind" such as "client's home" and an encounter.class = "virtual".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.definition: The location where the encounter takes place.
The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.
element.comment: When the patient is no longer active at a location, then the period end date is entered, and the status may be changed to completed.

element.short: Time period during which the patient was present at the location
element.definition: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

element.short: The custodian organization of this Encounter record
element.definition: An organization that is in charge of maintaining the information of this Encounter (e.g. who maintains the report or the master service catalog item, etc.). This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different. This MAY not be not the Service Delivery Location's Organization.

mapping.map: PV1-10 / PL.6  & PL.1  (note: HL7 v2 definition is "the treatment or type of surgery that the patient is scheduled to receive"; seems slightly out of alignment with the concept name 'hospital service'. Would not trust that implementations apply this semantic by default)

element.short: Another Encounter this encounter is part of
element.definition: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).
element.comment: This is also used for associating a child's encounter back to the mother's encounter.Refer to the Notes section in the Patient resource for further details.

element.definition: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.
If content was generated during a patient encounter, related encounter is the encounter where the information was gained.
The person or organization who created the entry and is responsible for (and may certify) the content.
The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from who created the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.
The most specific code (lowest level term) describing the kind or sort of thing being represented.
A class or division of people or things having particular shared characteristics
ActionContext indicating actual performance or execution of a healthcare-related action, e.g., 3rd dose of Hepatitis B vaccine administered on Dec 4th 2012, appendectomy performed today.
The date when the provider received a referral for service. A referral includes an oral, written, faxed or electronic request for services made by the client or on the client's behalf.
The type of person or entity that instigated the encounter.
Whether the patient is undergoing treatment voluntarily, or under a legal order.
The source of payment for the current encounter.
